Strengthening Community Safety through Local Government Capacity Building
http://www.undp.org/content/dam/undp/documents/projects/JAM/00043815/Strengthening Community Safety Through Local Government Capacity Building.pdf

outputs.output_descr: Support to the Jamaica Violence Prevention Peace and Sustainable Development  Programme (JSPD).The programme will strengthen the capacity of the GoJ and civil society to adopt a multi sectoral approach to armed violence prevention by enhancing the design of policies, building capacity of institutions, increasing the effectiveness of donor support, targeting community interventions and developing an integrated UN Country Team programme.

1)  Assessment of the local context for women's safety
2) Safety and audit recommendations implemented
3) Empowerment of women in selected communities
4) Improved capacity of local authorities to address gender in development planning and implementation

o	Harmonisation and enhancement of armed violence data.
o	National policies developed on community safety, restorative justice and small arms control.

o	Ministry of National Security to develop policy and implement community safety and crime prevention programmes.
o	National Security Strategy Implementation Unit to coordinate the implementation of the National Security Policy.
o	Jamaica Constabulary Force and National Firearm Licensing Authority to control small arms.
o	Civil society organisations to conduct advocacy and deliver services in communities.
o	Parliamentary sub-committee to provide oversight of government actions. 
o	Organised Crime Watch at University of West Indies to conduct research and inform policy.

o	Developing and implementing community safety plans.
o	Establishing community peace and justice centres.
o	Controlling the spread of small arms.
o	Supporting safe schools programme

o	Conducting joint UNCT needs assessments in target communities.
o	Facilitate inter-agency collaboration on armed violence prevention.
o	Facilitate design of joint UN inter-agency programme.

i) Increase the capacity of the Government to coordinate the government, civil society and donor response to the crisis ii) support the Office of the Public Defender to engage independent forensic pathologists to observe autopsies of civilians killed in the security operation iii) produce a report on the economic cost of the violence iv) support a cash-for-work project to repair the main market and other basic infrastructure damaged in the violence v) conduct preparatory work for a broad-based and inclusive national dialogue to ensure that May 2010 GoJ commitments on good governance are implemented vi) explore options for truth and reconciliation to help build trust and social cohesion
